channel.title: Daniel Cabral's architect portfolio squarespace issues
channel.description:
[quote="Daniel Cabral"] Subject: Help with multiple issues on a Squarespace project
Message: First, a little context: the website is the portfolio for an architect. It starts with a cover page that links to the portuguese and the english version of the website. The english version is actually a second squarespace project, identical to the first and pointing to a subdomain.
The issues I need to fix are the following:
COVER PAGE
- Logo on cover page is not centrally aligned on mobile. It is always a little to the right, and depending on the screen size, a lot to the right.
SITE IN PORTUGUESE
- The site is not loading properly on mobile (smartphones or ipads). The layout is rendered too different from what the template is supposed to look like (http://flatiron-demo.squarespace.com/).
- on the page “projetos”, the name of each project is not showing up on top of the picture, as it should do.
- On a project’s page, images should occupy the whole screen, but are actually rather small and aligned to the right. In some smartphones, the images simply don’t load.
SITE IN ENGLISH
- For some reason, it seems like on mobile devices, the website is not loading the same visual template as the portuguese site.
- On a project’s page, images should occupy the whole screen, but are actually rather small and aligned to the right. In some smartphones, the images simply don’t load.
- The website is supposed to appear under the subdomain “english.semerene.com”, but it is not working very well. If I click in any link, even for another website, it keeps showing on the URL address the same “english.semerene.com”. Try clicking on the logo, for example. It leads you to the same page hosted on “semerene.com”, but the address bar shows “english.semerene.com”.
INSTAGRAM BLOCK
- On page “diario visual” or “visual journal”: for some reason, there is a “hole” on the grid of instagram images. [/quote]
<small>"post can't be empty" due to discourse bug. message to be removed</small>

item.description:
@cregox wrote:

Dear Daniel,

It just so happen I'm in between jobs right now or else I would simply say I couldn't take this gig. Also I don't do this kind of work since June past year for many reasons I've already talked about.

So, before I even try to analyze anything here I want to ask you:

  • Have you read the (discontinued) "your home" page?

  • Given the number of issues alone, this will be at least a 1 day project, at U$984. Should we proceed talking business?
